sentences.en: A lecturer in the English Department has recently been refused tenure.
sentences.cn: 英语系一名讲师最近未能获得终身职位.

sentences.en: Finally, Matsushita promotes managerial continuity through long job tenure.
sentences.cn: 最后松下通过延长任职期,推进管理的延续性.

sentences.en: He has recently been refused tenure.
sentences.cn: 他最近被拒绝授予终身职位.

sentences.en: He holds his life on a happy tenure.
He holds his life on a precarious tenure.
sentences.cn: 他过着朝不保夕的生活.

sentences.en: He was in the middle of his tenure as Oxford Professor of Poetry and at the height of his fame.
sentences.cn: 当时，他在牛津担任诗歌教授的聘期刚到一半，声誉正隆。

sentences.en: Homage was accordingly the acknowledgment of the bond of tenure between lord and tenant.
sentences.cn: 效忠同样也是对领主和佃户之间租赁契约的确认.

sentences.en: It’s becoming increasingly difficult to acquire academic tenure .
sentences.cn: 获得终身教职现在越来越难了。

sentences.en: Junior staff have only a slim chance of getting tenure.
sentences.cn: 初级职员得到终身职位的机会十分渺茫。

sentences.en: Land tenure is a leading political issue in many parts of the world.
sentences.cn: 土地的保有权在世界很多地区是主要的政治问题.

sentences.en: On what tenure does he hold the house?
sentences.cn: 他凭什么占用这所房子?

sentences.en: Only the ships had most of them been laid down in my tenure.
sentences.cn: 只有舰船,大部分是在我任职期间开始建造的.

sentences.en: She felt the insecurity of her tenure of her brother's hospitality.
sentences.cn: 她感到,她在她弟弟府上的居留权已朝不保夕.

sentences.en: The company has doubled in value during his tenure.
sentences.cn: 在他的任期内，公司的市值翻了一番。

sentences.en: There might be a few steps in the chain of tenure.
sentences.cn: 在土地保有权的环节中可能存在几个步骤.

sentences.en: When women leave firms that practice permanent employment, their tenure is broken.
sentences.cn: 妇女一旦离开实施终生雇佣制的企业, 她们的权益也就终止了.

words.tran_cn: 授予…终身职位（tenure的过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 可授予终生职位的聘雇制度

trans.tran_cn: 占有（职位，不动产等），占有期，终身职位
trans.tran_en: the period of time when someone has an important job
